Dear Ms. McClain:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
10/21/2021. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, sections of the contract
and Modified Implementation Sustainability and Exit Plan (MISEP) requirements, a written
corrective action plan is required. It should be noted that violations of any licensing rules
are also violations of the MISEP and your contract. The corrective action plan is due 15
days from the date of this letter and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MISEP citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel at (616) 204-
6992.
Sincerely,

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
R 400.155 Institutions not detention institutions or shelter care
institutions; initial treatment plan.
(2) The initial treatment plan developed by the social worker
shall document input from the resident, the resident’s parents,
direct care staff, and the referral source, unless documented as
inappropriate.
One of three youth files reviewed did not have the youth’s signature on the initial
treatment plan.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that there are
additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The facility is in
compliance will all additional MISEP requirements.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHHS Contract/Policy violation. Please note
that there are additional DHHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be included in
section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHHS Contract/Policy
requirements.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
 An employee file was reviewed where the employee disclosed criminal
charges however the two criminal background checks that had been
completed did not show any criminal record for the employee. The employee
wrote a statement about his criminal charges however the facility did not
complete a written evaluation to address the criminal record as it was not on
his background check. Technical Assistance was given that the facility should
address any criminal charges that an employee discloses to document they
are aware and deem the individual appropriate for employment.
V. CONSULTATION
No consultation was requested or required.
1

VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no incidents of substantiated child abuse and/or neglect during this
licensing period.
The facility had eleven special investigations during this period under review with six
resulting in corrective action plans. The facility’s corrective action plan compliance is
monitored quarterly and have completed all current corrective action plans.
The East Campus was toured during the inspection and was very clean and in good
condition. There were no safety concerns noted during the inspection. The medication
carts were all double locked, safety and bed checks were in compliance, menus were
visible for youth and staff, and all units were orderly.
Staff and youth interviews were conducted during the inspection and no issues or
concerns were raised. The youth all reported feeling safe living at East Campus. The
staff all reported feeling supported by direct supervisors as well as administration.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon
receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility
continue on their regular license.
